moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4: I responded to e4 with the French defence.
The computer says this is book to this point.
The computer says this is a mistake. My idea was to exchange pawns and open the file for my R.
moves.11. Re1 Be7: Inaccuracy, and looking at it I really should have ...bxc5.
moves.12... bxc5 13. a3 O-O: The computer is happy with these moves.
moves.14. Nd2 f6: Mistake. It says I should have moved g5. But doesn't that go against basic training to preserve the K's defences?
moves.15. Nb3 Ne5 16. Nxc5 Nxf3+: Inaccuracy. I thought this was a good exchange as the board starts to open up.
moves.17. Qxf3 Bxc5 18. bxc5 Re8 19. Bd6 Bb5 2: Mistake. I should have protected my B with Qd7, instead I opened the file for his R.
moves.21. Rb7 Qa5: Blunder. Now the game is lost. Not the first time I've lost a game by moving my Q out of the fray.
moves.23... Qxc3: Another blunder, I could have salvaged something by exchanging rooks instead, says the computer.
